availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John G. Burba (Larue County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Larue County, Kentucky, farmer. Hardin County, Kentucky, native. Son of Scammel Burba and Lydia Flanders Burba. Married to Synthia A. Rachford Burba in Larue County, Kentucky, on July 25, 1852. Father of M. E. Burba, Benjamin H. Burba, Lydia C. Burba, Rhoda E. Burba, and John R. Burba. Shoemaker in Larue County in 1850. Farmer in Larue County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, Hamiltons, p. 420A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, p. 245.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, Hodgenville, p. 39B.
"John Green Burba (1826-1907)," Find A Grave, Memorial #8235355, accessed February 18, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8235355.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994044, Larue County Marriages.
